summary:
• Strategic Energy Reserve Agreement: Genesis, Mercury, Meridian, and Contact signed 10-year Huntly Firming Options (HFOs) for 150 MW total (50 MW each) to secure backup electricity capacity at Huntly Power Station, supporting national energy security until 2035.
  • Fuel Reserve: Genesis to establish up to 600,000 tonnes of solid fuel (coal initially, transitioning to biomass) for dry winters.
  • Key Date: Agreements intended to take effect from 1 January 2026, pending Commerce Commission review.
  • Market Impact: HFOs aim to stabilize wholesale prices and ensure capacity availability for wider market participants.
  • Operational Context: Huntly’s 720 MW Rankine units (gas/coal) critical for grid stability; one unit’s 2026 decommissioning delayed to 2035 under these agreements.

Omitted: Background on 2024 winter shortages, HFO contract mechanics, media/analyst contacts.

• 2nd Quarter Group Sales: $192.9 million (+2.07% YoY).
  • 1st Half Group Sales: $371.3 million (99.8% of prior year).
  • Online Sales Share: 19.36% of Group sales (vs. 18.77% prior year).
  • Inventory: Value below prior year.
  • Expected NPAT: Not less than $29 million for 1H.
  • Margin Pressure: Gross profit margin impacted by economic downturn.
  • Half-Year Results Date: To be released 10 September 2025 (interim dividend expected).

Strategic Energy Reserve Agreement Announcement:
- Meridian Energy signs agreement with Genesis, Mercury, and Contact to establish a strategic energy reserve at Huntly Power Station (NZ).
- Aims to address gas shortages and ensure electricity system reliability/price stability.
- Subject to Commerce Commission review; intended start date: 1 January 2026.
- Other parties may access reserve post-approval.

Material Impact:
- Enhances energy security and mitigates dry-year risk for the sector (10-year horizon).
- Supports Meridian’s renewable generation strategy while securing backup capacity.

No financial terms or capital-raising details disclosed.

No material information identified

(Note: The announcement concerns a non-executive director appointment, which is unlikely to impact trading or capital markets decisions in the short term. Omitted as non-material per guidelines.)

THL Growth Roadmap Announcement Summary

Key Highlights:

  • Growth Targets:
  • Aims to achieve $100M NPAT within 3–4 years.

  • Assumes ~25% rental days growth (still below pre-COVID levels), inflation-adjusted yields, and $100M+ net debt reduction.

  • Strategic Initiatives:

  • UK & Ireland review: Exploring divestment to reallocate capital.
  • Manufacturing cost gap: NZ production 20% cheaper than Australia for some models—plans to address this.
  • Australian Retail Sales: Reducing inventory ($72M from $110M peak) and optimizing brands.

  • North America: Accelerating synergy project post-tariff-free RV movement between US/Canada.

  • Financial Outlook (FY26+):

  • Rental revenue growth driven by fleet utilization improvements (fleet: ~8,500 vehicles, +8% YoY).

  • Debt reduction: Targeting ~$50M decrease in FY26–27 via earnings and lower capex.

  • Risks: Slower tourism recovery, economic downturns, tariff changes, and execution risks.

Next Update:

  • FY25 results to be released 25 August 2025 with progress updates.

Omitted: Operational details, market commentary, non-material assumptions.
